channel.title: Player Help Please!

item.title: Player Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Soull3sss1 Soull3sss1
item.description:
@Soull3sss1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550337”]You didn’t put the same variable in the “reading” part as you did the “writing”

} else if (token.equals("NomadQuest")) {

The code loading the player is expecting a token named “NomadQuest”.

But here, you’re saving it as:

As you can see, they’re not the same name
[hr]

The nomad-quest will not save and when i try to change the integer? the 11. to 12 13 14 or whatsoever it makes no sense. Can someone help me with this problem.
Best Reguards
-Tyler

The integer “11” is the length of the text you’re saving.

0 is the start, 11 is the end. Any letters/text added after the 11th (technically 12th) will not be saved.
Honestly, I have always wondered why people do saving like this. Don’t quote me on this, but I do not believe there’s a performance gain from saving the text with the size.

You could change your code for saving the “nomad” variable to this:

characterfile.write("nomad-Quest = " + Integer.toString(p.nomad)); characterfile.newLine();
And you’d get the same result, or essentially.

Just make sure to name both the saving and loading the same.[/quote]

Thanks you so much SK8r you are literally a genius! Thank you!<3!!! REP:D

Read full topic

item.title: Player Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You didn’t put the same variable in the “reading” part as you did the “writing”

} else if (token.equals("NomadQuest")) {

The code loading the player is expecting a token named “NomadQuest”.

But here, you’re saving it as:

As you can see, they’re not the same name
[hr]

[quote=“Soull3sss1, post:1, topic:550337”]The nomad-quest will not save and when i try to change the integer? the 11. to 12 13 14 or whatsoever it makes no sense. Can someone help me with this problem.
Best Reguards
-Tyler[/quote]

The integer “11” is the length of the text you’re saving.

0 is the start, 11 is the end. Any letters/text added after the 11th (technically 12th) will not be saved.
Honestly, I have always wondered why people do saving like this. Don’t quote me on this, but I do not believe there’s a performance gain from saving the text with the size.

You could change your code for saving the “nomad” variable to this:

characterfile.write("nomad-Quest = " + Integer.toString(p.nomad)); characterfile.newLine();
And you’d get the same result, or essentially.

Just make sure to name both the saving and loading the same.

item.title: Player Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Soull3sss1 Soull3sss1
item.description:
@Soull3sss1 wrote:

So i am having a constant problem of when i added a quest. say i start it, and the character gets through half the quest then they logout, the quest does not save and they have to restart all over again? I know i added the right stuff into playersave…
But here is what i have in PLayerSave.java

} else if (token.equals("dragonfire-shield")) { p.dfsCount = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("NomadQuest")) { p.nomad = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

THen whe write part

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("nomad-Quest = ", 0, 11); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.nomad), 0, Integer.toString(p.nomad).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("ancient-dragon = ", 0, 11);

The nomad-quest will not save and when i try to change the integer? the 11. to 12 13 14 or whatsoever it makes no sense. Can someone help me with this problem.
Best Reguards
-Tyler

Read full topic
